job_title: New College Grad - ATE Process Engineer ID1
job_description:
• Applies SPC, FDC, and 8D methodology to process optimization, testing, creating, and modifying process related procedures, and disposition of lots to increase the tool availability and turns through systematic problem solving Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Material Science, or Physics.
• However, other engineering or related fields may be considered Must be flexible to work any shift and rotate shifts as needed (allowing for flexibility around school schedule where applicable) New College Grad - Semiconductor Quality Assurance EngineerManassas, Virginia, United States of AmericaPosted 14 days ago Proficient in one or more scripting, programming and visualization tools: Python, Java, Tableau, Matlab, Microsoft Suite New College Grad - Engineer, Electrical Design – FPGA/ASICBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 20 days ago Completes all required safety training and conducts all work in accordance with safety policies and regulations New College Grad - Diffusion Equipment EngineerManassas, Virginia, United States of AmericaPosted 20 days ago New College Grad - Process Integration EngineerBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 8 days ago Analyzes data using various application and engineering knowledge to make critical process decisions.

• Minimum of a Bachelor’s of Science Degree in Engineering or related science from an accredited university2+ years of applicable experience in the automotive or a related industry OR Master’s degree preferred Cursory understanding of primary vehicle systems, with experience running and maintaining a variety of vehicle level and component level tests a bonus Familiarity with work management systems similar to JIRA, JAMA, or Confluence for test planning, coordination, execution and issue tracking Experience with software related to CAD, vehicle level instrumentation, calibration, data logging and data acquisition systems Must have a valid driver's license in the state of residence that you will be driving/operating a vehicle 2+ years of applicable experience in the automotive or a related industry OR Master’s degree preferred No drug or alcohol related driving incidents in the last 3 years No more than 1 serious moving violation in the last 3 years Experience with high performance driving is a bonus.
• Prepare and update test vehicles (hardware, software) and document condition and performance pre / during / post test for multiple attributes (NVH, Performance, Body / Chassis Structural Durability, others) as prescribed in test standards.
